title: The Mill on the Floss - "of equal necessity"

content.question: By commenting that the Dodsons viewed the things described in the seventh sentence as being “of equal necessity,” the narrator emphasizes the Dodsons’

choices.label: failure to acknowledge their own mortality
keen sense of their own spiritual shortcomings
indifference to traditional Protestant practices followed by their parents
tendency not to distinguish between the spiritual and the practical

content.answer: tendency not to distinguish between the spiritual and the practical

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
